Pancrasweek meadow. Saved with your help. Holding water. Full of snipe. Flock of 40 went up. Dairy land all around. Dead and desolate. What a landscape it must have been when all was this. A fragment now. https://t.co/d0zGhwsU2P

Measuring flows on the #river Teme this morning at Knighstford bridge. We recently removed the weir here and so these high #flow #measurements are crucial to check the river gauge is operating correctly since. @EnvAgencyMids @DaveThroupEA https://t.co/770ZY5d9To

tweets.text:
Weekly Wrap | @EnvAgency dismisses concern over poor condition of 3,400 flood assets 

Story: https://t.co/GoWOtwei66 

#Construction #Engineering #CivilEngineering #Infrastructure #Floods #FloodDefences #Environment #ClimateChange

Officers are investigating a blue discolouration to Northcliffe Dike near Shipley. This blue colour is thought to be caused by a trace dye, which would represent a low risk of harm to the environment. If you see a potential environmental hazard, report it to us on 0800 807060 https://t.co/Or8OV6N4EV

#FieldTeams have been out again today clearing screens and checking our #CriticalAssets in #Warwickshire. Video taken by Daz earlier today from Mill Bridge in #Leamington. Check your #FloodRisk and stay #FloodAware. @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/nfaWuy0zBI

Oh dear, @AnglianWater. Once again big discarge of foul smelling water into River Hiz #chalkstream last evening. Too dark for photo so here‚Äôs reminder of previous at same spot Not an ‚Äòoutfall‚Äô here. Previous fix not fixed, maybe? @NorthHertsDC @AquiferChalk @IvelRev @EnvAgency https://t.co/kXaCvMMLl5

@AnglianWater @NorthHertsDC @AquiferChalk @IvelRev @EnvAgency All overflowing again yesterday (30 Jan 2021), so suspect the issue is still not resolved. Sorry. Look forward to hearing of a long-term fix.

@picturespete @NorthHertsDC @AquiferChalk @IvelRev @EnvAgency Hi Peter, thanks for getting back in touch. Our technician arrived on site and noticed the manhole next to the storm tank was full, so this was passed directly to our treatment team who attended site the same day to sort the issue. They've advised this is now resolved. Thank you
We have put up temporary barriers up in South Hinksey and they are working well. https://t.co/WPWRNWkE5L

tweets.text:
And
Why did DoNR flood?
Was Kidds Mill Sluice a factor?
If so why was it up to pple other than @thameswater & @EnvAgencySE to open it?
Why no Mogden sewage discharge alerts?
What help/support will affected householders get, and when?  
Hoping to hear! ruthcadburymp@parliament.uk https://t.co/YVtEO4tBVr https://t.co/u8qjqYZNkR

Sea defences breached at Chiswell on #Portland earlier tonight - siren sounded + cars swept away by flooding. One wave 23 feet for 17 secs around 8pm #stormchristoph #dorset #storm @EnvAgency @BBCRadioSolent @BBCSouthNews @BBCSpotlight https://t.co/fiCcVOpCTc

@EarthlyIdeas @theexterminato9 @AnglianWater @alex_green84 @jamesowild @BurnhamDeepdale @EnvAgency @mrnathannelson @BrancasterNT @StaitheSmoke 2/2 Environment Agency and Anglian Water staff are working closely together to help resolve this issue as river levels allow.¬†We are continually monitoring the situation.

The @EnvAgencyYNE #FieldTeam have installed 3 x Ultra High Volume Pumps at our Selby Dam pump station which is managed by @GavinTabinerEA.

All these pumps combined are moving in excess of 7m3 water every second!

Follow @GavinTabinerEA for all things #FieldOperations related üëç https://t.co/Zp81ZPqnKD

@sunkfarmer @westyeo @wheat_daddy @pastoralview @Drystonesonnet @agricontract @EnvAgency As they say, if you don't clean out your gutters, then they will overflow and ruin your house, same goes for rivers, but a lot more devestating.

@pastoralview @Drystonesonnet @agricontract @EnvAgency @westyeo This needs doing in so many parts of the country but more emphasis is put on preserving water voles homes than peoples homes, businesses and food production.

Our focus is on the lower #Severn and #Avon as peaks slowly move through at key locations #Worcester, #Evesham, #Tewkesbury & #Gloucester 

#StaySafe be vigilant be #Floodaware for the latest head to https://t.co/m0qK4XDnl4 https://t.co/DObVxKg5lj

A release of water from Ladybower Reservoir will begin around 1.30pm today to increase flood storage capacity ahead of the forecast of heavy rain from Tuesday am. 

The River Derwent will rise slightly down to #Matlock #Derbyshire https://t.co/By730fQKjg

Why there was a sudden discharge from the sewage works?
Was there a failure of infrastructure which saw the capacity of the site overwhelmed and walls breached?
What precautions are now in place? https://t.co/pkFH6MyHDj

urls.title: They brought how much contaminated waste to the Fens?
urls.description: No action is planned against the operators of a disused pit at Whittlesey in which 122,858 tonnes of illegal waste have been dumped.

tweets.text: LRT by @johnelworthy ***How much waste?!?*** "'Hazardous' chemical contaminants found in 122,000 tonnes of unlawful waste" https://t.co/3sIcY34oY5 So it's not just on water issues that @EnvAgencyAnglia is being weak on enforcement. @greenarteries @TerryMac999
The #JubileeRiver in operation, diverting water from the #Thames to reduce river levels to lower the risk of flooding. https://t.co/1JjOIbfrNu

@EarthlyIdeas @theexterminato9 @AnglianWater @alex_green84 @jamesowild @BurnhamDeepdale @EnvAgency @mrnathannelson @BrancasterNT @StaitheSmoke 1/2 As river levels are so high at the moment due to the recent heavy rainfall, we‚Äôre unable to issue a permit for Anglian Water to pump water into the River Burn as this would increase flood risk to many more properties.

Is this @YorkshireWater ?
Greedy bastards. Invest in treatment not in profits you filthy animals. The enablers the @EnvAgency should hang their heads in shame, a waste of space. https://t.co/7fpE85upwa

MY DAY: Editing report on @SouthCambs vote on Waterbeach New Town; delving into major report on flooding in Cambridgeshire; returning to 120,000 tonnes of   illegal waste dumped in Whittlesey and the debate on how @EastCambs is to tackle parking enforcement. Alexa - play Radio 2
@wheat_daddy @pastoralview @Drystonesonnet @agricontract @EnvAgency @westyeo And tide marks 7ft up the tree trunks. Was just a deadly silence of wildlife carnage

It‚Äôs been a very wet Saturday, our teams are out in the borough monitoring  rivers & following up reports of any flooding concerns. If you have a concern, call the @EnvAgency helpline 0345 988 1188 or the out of hours emergency line 01708 433999 visit https://t.co/exBluI9NNb https://t.co/cFHwtNTFmW

@sunkfarmer @pastoralview @Drystonesonnet @agricontract @EnvAgency @westyeo I remember going in the spring soon after all the water had gone, the bushes and trees were full of debris and there was not one bird singing or a rabbit or hare running around, terrible. There will always be far more wildlife perish after a flood than with river maintenance. https://t.co/FldS94gsUs

@wheat_daddy @pastoralview @Drystonesonnet @agricontract @EnvAgency @westyeo Ah but if the water levels get to high the water voles and other wildlife simply die of drowning. Memory goes to Somerset during the floods and seeing so much wildlife floating around you were there too Wardy and like me i guess you'd have found it fairly depressing.

@agricontract @EnvAgency This is before and after of the River Parrot in Somerset after they flooded in 2014. Just look at the extra water holding capacty. Maintenance still going on, Needless to say they‚Äôve not flooded since. @westyeo will fill you in. https://t.co/qrFWkko5nD

tweets.text: See very little about the impact HS2 will have on the aquifer that supplies our local Chalk Rivers and our domestic drinking water supplies. @AffinityWater and the @EnvAgency are scrambling around to mitigate the risk of damage to aquifer by changing abstraction licences.
Still big waves on Portland this morning - confirmed one Coastguard Officer injured in last night‚Äôs flooding incident at Chiswell #storm @EnvAgency @MCA_media https://t.co/dhHepeSFz1
